data.message: Been there done that in Midland Tx.during a"sand storm"

replies.message: We pitched a 10man army tent all the way to Sidney Mt. from Laurel,Ms.Thanks to my Daddy,my brother and I got to see many awesome sites-camping?
Sounds like an experience, Tina! Thanks for being part of our community. -Hailey
That sounds like an amazing experience, Tina! Thanks for sharing with us. -Hailey
Having lived in Midland I know the tent stakes had to be at least 5ft down and then you still would be covered in dust and tumbleweeds.

I remember being 11yo and we were making a trip to Pikes Peak. First stop, Ft. Stockton(?), Tx. For some strange reason the tent was put together But not spiked down. Huge gust of wind and the tent becomes a kite. With little 'ol me holding on to one corner of it yelling "moooooooom!" I swear I almost went airborne!
Sandy burgers off the grill Gritty!!
